newsitem.title: CANADA: DiverseyLever to shut Canada chemical plant.
newsitem.headline: DiverseyLever to shut Canada chemical plant.

text.p: DiverseyLever, a unit of Unilever Plc, said it will close a Canadian plant to reduce excess chemical manufacturing capacity in North America.
The plant in Mississauga, Ontario will close by late 1997 or early 1998 and eliminate 85 jobs, DiverseyLever said in a statement.
Administration functions such as customer service, sales, information technology, product development and marketing will remain in Mississauga, the company said.
DiverseyLever will operate three major chemical manufacturing plants in North America after the closure.
DiverseyLever's remaining chemical plants are located in London, Ontario; Stroudsburg, Pennsylvania and Sharonville, Ohio -- as well as regional bulk facilities across North America.

"DiverseyLever's industrial and institutional cleaning business is North American in scope, and we had to rationalize excess manufacturing capacity on a continental basis," said David Hull, senior vice-president of DiverseyLever.
Diversey was acquired by Unilever in 1996 from Canadian brewing giant Molson Cos Ltd.
